decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge, the deck aims to generate card advantage and ramp up to powerful threats. Embercleave provides a way to push through additional damage, while The Akroan War can disrupt the opponent's board. Fabled Passage helps fix mana and trigger landfall abilities, while Shatterskull Smashing provides extra removal. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats.

The focus of this deck is to establish control over the game using a combination of disruptive spells, removal, and powerful creatures. By managing the opponent's resources through targeted removal like Bloodchief's Thirst and Extinction Event, along with countering spells using Jwari Disruption and disrupting their hand with Ashiok, Nightmare Muse, the deck aims to control the game until it can stabilize and take over with powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Shark Typhoon. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra advantage.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategies by milling their deck, while also controlling the board through removal spells and counters. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Drown in the Loch, this deck can fill the opponent's graveyard quickly and make it harder for them to draw key cards. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, this deck aims to outlast the opponent in the long game by constantly generating value from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy by playing low-cost, efficient creatures that can quickly build up a strong board presence. The deck focuses on utilizing cards with abilities that provide protection and resilience for the creatures, while also incorporating a few higher-cost cards to provide additional utility and finishing power. By maintaining a steady stream of threats and utilizing cards like Maul of the Skyclaves and Heliod, Sun-Crowned to boost their strength, the deck aims to quickly outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing cards that mill the opponent's library, counter spells and removal. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by slowing down their deck and gaining card advantage through milling and drawing cards. By utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can bring back low-cost permanents from the graveyard, providing additional value and resilience. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to outlast the opponent by controlling the game and ultimately winning through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. By milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, the deck aims to enable the powerful Into the Story card draw ability and Zareth San's ability to play cards from the opponent's graveyard. The deck includes a mix of creatures, disruption, and card draw to maintain pressure and control throughout the game.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game through aggressive plays while using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast to generate card advantage. The Great Henge provides additional power and toughness to your creatures while also drawing cards. The deck also includes removal spells like Spikefield Hazard and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with opposing threats, and finishes games with the powerful Embercleave.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with small but powerful creatures and use various protection spells to maintain that presence. Cards like Luminarch Aspirant and Skyclave Apparition help generate threats while selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty protect those threats from removal spells. Giant Killer and Drannith Magistrate disrupt opponent's strategies, allowing for aggressive attacks. The deck also includes a small Angel package with Legion Angel and Emeria's Call for late-game value. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures and efficient combat tricks.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Brushfire Elemental. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embereth Shieldbreaker to control the board. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while Embercleave serves as a finisher for big damage. The deck aims to end the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and impactful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant to apply pressure on the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats while also maintaining card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Embercleave helps to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to rapidly build a board presence and end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on playing fast and aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes powerful combat tricks and removal spells to maintain board control. The main strategy is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, then finish the game with powerful finishers like Embercleave. The inclusion of The Great Henge provides additional card draw and buffing capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan with removal spells.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing creatures with high power and using them to deal damage to the opponent efficiently. It includes powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, as well as cards like Embercleave to further enhance their attacking capabilities. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge to generate value and maintain card advantage. By using a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, sacrifice effects, and disruptive creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Rankle, Master of Pranks, the deck aims to generate card advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Tymaret Calls the Dead to provide additional value. Overall, the strategy revolves around grinding out incremental advantages and eventually overwhelming the opponent with a mix of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures and utilizing mana ramp cards like Gilded Goose and Castle Garenbrig to play powerful threats ahead of schedule. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while also generating card advantage with cards like Trail of Crumbs and The Great Henge. With a combination of aggressive creatures and card advantage engines, this deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and maintain pressure on the opponent until victory is secured.

The primary focus of this deck is to establish control of the game through a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards such as Brazen Borrower, Bonecrusher Giant, and Terror of the Peaks, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own board presence. Additionally, cards like The Great Henge and Genesis Ultimatum provide card advantage and ramp potential, allowing the player to out-value their opponent in the late game. Overall, the deck's goal is to maintain control of the battlefield and ultimately overpower the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small but powerful white creatures, known as "Weenies." By playing aggressively and utilizing cards that support and protect these creatures, such as Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty, the goal is to quickly build a threatening board presence. Additionally, using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Maul of the Skyclaves can help provide extra damage and boost the creatures' effectiveness. The deck aims to finish off the opponent swiftly before they have a chance to stabilize.
